thread.title: Big Orlando land deal fuels talk of new resort or theme park
thread.title_full: Big Orlando land deal fuels talk of new resort or theme park

title: Big Orlando land deal fuels talk of new resort or theme park
text:
Big land deal near Orlando convention center fuels talk of new resort or theme park 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/31/15 3:01 am EDT - Updated: 7/31/15 3:10 am EDT 
ORLANDO, Florida — One of the largest tracts of vacant land in Orlando's tourism corridor could soon have a new owner — fueling speculation about a new theme park, giant resort or convention hotel. 
The Orlando Sentinel ( http://bit.ly/1VQK2VT ) reports that Colfin Orlando Funding LLC, a subsidiary of California-based real estate giant Colony Capital, is expected to soon buy the approximately 400-acre property known as the Sand Lake Road complex, just north of the Orange County Convention Center. 
The newspaper reports that Colfiin has reached an agreement to settle a $285 million foreclosure lawsuit with the property's current owner, a company owned by Georgia businessman Stan Thomas. 
Over the years, developers have floated plans for homes, resorts and retail that could be built there. 
A spokeswoman for Colony Capital declined to comment on the property. 
Information from: Orlando Sentinel, http://www.orlandosentinel.com/
